This was a fun experience, it sadly does not hold up as well as the other two, but it was still a fun time. The Game play was based more around a lot more running around and being less of a tank for bullets even during the late game, The story was confusing at first, but started to make sense later in the game even though in the end its hard to compare with the first and second game of the Bioshock Trilogy. If you like the Bioshock universe you will still like the third in the Trilogy as they all link together as one, but if you prefer more interesting game play and environment I preferred the other two more than the third. 

The Pieces I could not appreciate was the annoyance of having the ability to only pick up 2 weapons at a time, which felt wrong with how many times I needed to use a specific weapon at a certain time, to which I did not have it. The shield was interesting, but I preferred having the ability to hold med packs on me as I fought to which there became an advantage in looking around for extras. Also the hacking was useless as before you can make an army of defenses turn to your side, but instead they just decide to work only for a couple seconds to then be shooting you in the back of the head afterwards. The Alternate Reality was the only piece that was interesting, but it came up dry as you can just spawn in the same pieces over and over again until the area was cleared of foes, I saw potential but in the end I preferred relying on my own ability instead of Elizabeth. Elizabeth constantly throwing ammo, salts, health, money, etc... at me was also quite annoying even though helpful, I would have preferred to rely on what I found instead of her just generating such ammo and equipment out of thin air making some areas where I should have died less of a challenge.

The only piece that was fun and enjoyable was the connection of Rapture to this whole Bioshock Universe and the fun world they built up, very creative and original.

Finally the Downloadable Expansion Chapters was interesting as well. The first Chapter was similar to the Main Game and still yields the same results, the second Chapter being a sneaking around style game had much potential, but fell short of games like Dishonored and Thief that have a better vibe. In the end I played through all expansions just to have the nostalgic trips back into the amazing universe of rapture that I once survived through long ago.

In the end I still would suggest this purchase as It does finalize the Bioshock Trilogy even if this game does fall short from the other two. 6/10
Not as good as the first or second Bioshock games, and you don't need to play those to understand the storyline of this one. Still very entertaining, and love the graphics.

Wracam do tej gry po latach i nie mogę wyjść z podziwu, jak Infinite zostało pięknie skonstruowane, jaką oferuje niesamowitą historię. Najlepsza gra z serii Bioshock, niezwykle wyróżniająca się na tle poprzednich dwóch, a jednak z nimi bezsprzecznie związana i spójna - poprzez mechanikę, ale i opowieść. Infinite wygląda i brzmi obłędnie. Jest czarujące, hipnotyzujące, a wspaniałe widoki jeszcze silniej kontrastują z poznawanym dystopijnym światem i tragedią, jaka spada na głównych bohaterów i zwykłych ludzi. Bioshock zawsze poruszał trudne tematy społeczne, więc i w trzeciej odsłonie od nich nie stroni - rasizm, religijny fanatyzm czy ideały, które przeradzają się ostatecznie w źródło cierpienia. 

W Infinite gra się też o wiele przyjemniej niż w pierwszą i drugą część, bo nie dość, że zachowano świetny pomysł na plazmidy/wigory łączone z tradycyjną bronią, to jeszcze rozwinięto tę mechanikę i dopieszczono do tego stopnia, że możliwych kombinacji przy wykorzystywaniu tych narzędzi jest cała masa, a każda szalenie satysfakcjonująca. 

Nie zapomnę nigdy emocji, jakie towarzyszyły mi podczas pierwszego odkrywania opowieści i poznania jej finału. Porywająca i poruszająca fabuła to znak towarowy Bioshocka, ale Infinite pokazało, że twórcy gry są geniuszami, którzy nie tylko stworzyli ciekawą treść, ale też odpowiednio ją przedstawili - wszystkie informacje dawkowane na tyle, by wzbudzać ciekawość z każdym kolejnym zdobytym puzzlem, a i tak nic nie przygotowuje na finalne uderzenie. Tak, Bioshock Infinite porwał mnie i kupił całą. Jest wiele znakomitych gier, ale to takie tytuły udowadniają, że gry to medium dojrzałe, potrafiące wstrząsnąć umysłem i sercem do głębi równie mocno, jeśli nie bardziej niż inne media.

PS Sekwencja otwierająca grę: światło i dźwięki zasypujące wieżę oraz przejście przez świątynię można zaliczyć do czołówki najlepszych otwarć w grach czy w historiach wszelkiego typu w ogóle.

[b]Spoiler Free Review[/b]

My enjoyment of BioShock Infinite was not immediate, as the story starts out a little slow, but the deeper I got, the more I enjoyed it. The story, as well as the setting, was thought provoking from scientific, philosophical and social perspectives. I thought the voice acting and character development were fantastic, and the game was well worth every hour I put in. 

That's not to say it's a perfect game. The combat and movement systems felt a little dated for 2021, and the the auto-save feature is simply not good. As it's an older game, I think those are forgivable, but in the same light, I don't think you need to put down everything to play right now. If you can grab the game on sale, this story can make for a very enjoyable long weekend's worth of play.
I do recommend playing though. Without spoiling anything, I feel like some of the bigger concepts were not well rounded and the ending felt a bit underwhelming. Still a good story.

[h1]内有剧透请慎重选择查看[/h1]

1893年出生了个小女孩，名叫安娜(后改名为伊丽莎白），父母是布克和安娜贝尔，但安娜贝尔在分娩时抢救不当，最终消香玉陨。悲痛万分的布克从此一蹶不振，沉迷于赌博和酗酒中无法自拔
繁重的债务促使着布克走向了一条不归路，自伊丽莎白出生以来她就有两个来自不同时空的父亲。一个是布克，另一个则是改名为康姆斯托克的布克
失魂落魄的布克把年幼的伊丽莎白卖给了平行世界的康姆斯托克，就为了还赌博酗酒的债务，而康姆斯托克呢，因为频繁地使用跨时空机器，导致失去了生育能力。于是乎，康姆斯托克命令自己的手下前往不同的平行世界寻找自己的子嗣，很快找到了布克的女儿安娜，并对布克说如果将女儿交出来债务就一笔勾销。
那一天布克彻底后悔了，与另一个自己抢夺自己的女儿，在时空门关上的那一刻 伊丽莎白的小拇指被切断了，连接了两个时空，这一刻伊丽莎白成为了量子观察者并拥有了跨时空和平行世界的能力，这就是一切的起因
在结局，伊丽莎白带着布克了解了一切的真相，此时布克才明白伊丽莎白才是自己的女儿，而康姆斯托克是平行时空另一个误入歧途的自己。
在当初接受洗礼后的布克成为了康姆斯托克，他的本性和内心也就发生了改变，找到了路特斯兄妹并创建了哥伦比亚(天空之城）然后发明机器开启了异次元大门，导致了后续的一系列悲剧
最终，布克回到了当初洗礼的水边，无数的平行世界重叠在一起，布克看着多个平行世界的伊丽莎白，她们伸出双手溺死了自己，生命也就走向了终结，最初的布克死了，无数平行世界的伊丽莎白也变成了唯一

海葬DLC-1
在主世界还存在的唯一一个伊丽莎白还存在于世间，此时的她拥有着神力，可以自由穿梭在各大平行宇宙和时空。而有一个康姆斯托克在交换安娜时，出乎预料的是年幼的安娜被拦腰折断，死在了康姆斯托克面前，随后他求卢特斯利用时空机器送到销魂城(一代二代的主要场景）并在那里改名为布克成为了私家侦探，后来在收养一个小女孩萨丽一段时间后，突然发现在自己赌博时被抓走并改造成为litter sister，最后这个康姆斯托克的真实身份被伊丽莎白识破，接着惭愧的康姆斯托克被大老爹用转头捅穿背部而死。
海葬DLC-2
接着上一段剧情，大老爹暴走将康姆斯托克和伊丽莎白杀死，而伊丽莎白在销魂城中获得了重生，失去了穿梭的能力，此时的伊丽莎白也看到了一代的主角杰克也代替她去拯救litter sister，最后为了换回萨丽的自由，在被亚特拉斯(一代最终boss）扳手的重击下慢慢失去了意识。漆黑的背景和昏暗的灯光衬托着一位女人临死前的凄凉鲜血沾满了伊丽莎白的脸颊，她的灵魂和生命即将要抵达人生的终点，眼前浮现着一代主角杰克打败方玎拯救萨丽的片段，最终这个伊丽莎白的使命就此达成，结束了那场永无止境的人间悲剧
[*]我想回到1893年10月8号那天
[*]那是我将你送走的那天
[*]那是我开始失去你的那天
[*]那时你还是我的Anna
[*]如果能够重来一次的话
[*]我保证再也不会让你离开我了

I loved this game so much, it's absolutely on par with how phenomenal Bioshock 1 was in terms of gameplay and story! The world building was fantastic, and it's very easy to lose yourself in the city of Columbia because of how detailed and gorgeous it is. I would definitely come back to this game just to spend a little more time exploring the city and the audio logs. Overall, the story was compelling and you end up getting really attached to the characters too (not to mention the jaw-dropping ending)

Aside from the story, I really enjoyed the weapons in this Bioshock more than the other games. I found myself picking favorites, especially in combination with the different vigors (plasmids) you're given access to. You don't even need to play the other Bioshock games to enjoy this one, it rarely references the others and it has a totally different story. If you're hesitating to get this game, just go ahead and buy it because it's THAT good

Play this game it's a must!

While it's not as genre-changing as the original Bioshock, this game still delivers a unique narrative on a unique setting that I'm happy it's part of the franchise.  The gameplay is fresh enough and the new powers are really fun to use. It's insane how what seems to be an escort mission isn't as tedious as they usually are. Play it.
